messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/4/2003 6:11:23 PM Central Daylight Time,
jggilbert@... writes:

> Tom,
> While I was a bit dubious about the results of any Google search strings
> containing the words "Japan" and "leather," after trying a few things I turned
> up a pretty interesting article:
>
> http://jbe.gold.ac.uk/7/alldritt001.html
>
> Long but there are some very relevant bits in there.

>

while we are on the anthropology thread............ read current issue of the
National Geographic for an article on the " untouchables " in India.
Also i recall reading about the Burakamin in same magazine a few years back
( at least 10 ) , may be the National Geo. web site has a search/archive
function ?
The present day eta are living in separate neighborhoods, background checks
on marriage etc etc.

milt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] kawa workers
messages.msgSnippet: Tom, While I was a bit dubious about the results of any Google search strings containing the words Japan and leather, after  trying a few things I turned
messages.messageBody:
Tom,
While I was a bit dubious about the results of any Google search strings containing the words "Japan" and "leather," after trying a few things I turned up a pretty interesting article:

http://jbe.gold.ac.uk/7/alldritt001.html

Long but there are some very relevant bits in there.

Jim


Jim-
Your not missing anything, I am. I believe you, of
course.Presented only with this tsuba I would say it is for a shinae.
Checked my meagre references for leather trade, but found no love...
-t

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
